meanings.definition: The act of moving back and forth or side to side.
meanings.sent1: The gentle libration of the boat made me feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: I observed the libration of the pendulum as it swung.
meanings.sent3: The libration of the swing set made it seem like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a libration, shifting in tone with each sentence.
meanings.sent5: The libration of the branches in the wind was mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The table had a noticeable libration whenever someone walked by.
meanings.sent2: The libration of the car on the bumpy road was unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The libration of the jelly on the plate made it look alive.
meanings.sent4: His confidence had a libration, wavering with each challenge.
meanings.sent5: The libration of the leaves in the breeze was calming.

meanings.definition: The apparent oscillation of the moon.
meanings.sent1: The libration of the moon was visible through the telescope.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the libration of the moon to understand its movement.
meanings.sent3: The libration of the moon made it look like it was nodding in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The libration of the moon created a mystical aura in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the libration of the moon during the eclipse.
